00033  * This file is part of Lustre, http://www.lustre.org/
00034  * Lustre is a trademark of Sun Microsystems, Inc.

00036  * lustre/ldlm/ldlm_pool.c

00038  * Author: Yury Umanets <umka@clusterfs.com>

00041 /*
00042  * Idea of this code is rather simple. Each second, for each server namespace
00043  * we have SLV - server lock volume which is calculated on current number of
00044  * granted locks, grant speed for past period, etc - that is, locking load.
00045  * This SLV number may be thought as a flow definition for simplicity. It is
00046  * sent to clients with each occasion to let them know what is current load
00047  * situation on the server. By default, at the beginning, SLV on server is
00048  * set max value which is calculated as the following: allow to one client
00049  * have all locks of limit ->pl_limit for 10h.
00050  *
00051  * Next, on clients, number of cached locks is not limited artificially in any
00052  * way as it was before. Instead, client calculates CLV, that is, client lock
00053  * volume for each lock and compares it with last SLV from the server. CLV is
00054  * calculated as the number of locks in LRU * lock live time in seconds. If
00055  * CLV > SLV - lock is canceled.
00056  *
00057  * Client has LVF, that is, lock volume factor which regulates how much sensitive
00058  * client should be about last SLV from server. The higher LVF is the more locks
00059  * will be canceled on client. Default value for it is 1. Setting LVF to 2 means
00060  * that client will cancel locks 2 times faster.
00061  *
00062  * Locks on a client will be canceled more intensively in these cases:
00063  * (1) if SLV is smaller, that is, load is higher on the server;
00064  * (2) client has a lot of locks (the more locks are held by client, the bigger
00065  *     chances that some of them should be canceled);
00066  * (3) client has old locks (taken some time ago);
00067  *
00068  * Thus, according to flow paradigm that we use for better understanding SLV,
00069  * CLV is the volume of particle in flow described by SLV. According to this,
00070  * if flow is getting thinner, more and more particles become outside of it and
00071  * as particles are locks, they should be canceled.
00072  *
00073  * General idea of this belongs to Vitaly Fertman (vitaly@clusterfs.com). Andreas
00074  * Dilger (adilger@clusterfs.com) proposed few nice ideas like using LVF and many
00075  * cleanups. Flow definition to allow more easy understanding of the logic belongs
00076  * to Nikita Danilov (nikita@clusterfs.com) as well as many cleanups and fixes.
00077  * And design and implementation are done by Yury Umanets (umka@clusterfs.com).
00078  *
00079  * Glossary for terms used:
00080  *
00081  * pl_limit - Number of allowed locks in pool. Applies to server and client
00082  * side (tunable);
00083  *
00084  * pl_granted - Number of granted locks (calculated);
00085  * pl_grant_rate - Number of granted locks for last T (calculated);
00086  * pl_cancel_rate - Number of canceled locks for last T (calculated);
00087  * pl_grant_speed - Grant speed (GR - CR) for last T (calculated);
00088  * pl_grant_plan - Planned number of granted locks for next T (calculated);
00089  * pl_server_lock_volume - Current server lock volume (calculated);
00090  *
00091  * As it may be seen from list above, we have few possible tunables which may
00092  * affect behavior much. They all may be modified via proc. However, they also
00093  * give a possibility for constructing few pre-defined behavior policies. If
00094  * none of predefines is suitable for a working pattern being used, new one may
00095  * be "constructed" via proc tunables.
00096  */
00097

00109 /*
00110  * 50 ldlm locks for 1MB of RAM.
00111  */
00112 #define LDLM_POOL_HOST_L ((NUM_CACHEPAGES >> (20 - PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT)) * 50)
00113 
00114 /*
00115  * Maximal possible grant step plan in %.
00116  */
00117 #define LDLM_POOL_MAX_GSP (30)
00118 
00119 /*
00120  * Minimal possible grant step plan in %.
00121  */
00122 #define LDLM_POOL_MIN_GSP (1)
00123 
00124 /*
00125  * This controls the speed of reaching LDLM_POOL_MAX_GSP
00126  * with increasing thread period.
00127  */
00128 #define LDLM_POOL_GSP_STEP_SHIFT (2)
00129 
00130 /*
00131  * LDLM_POOL_GSP% of all locks is default GP.
00132  */
00133 #define LDLM_POOL_GP(L)   (((L) * LDLM_POOL_MAX_GSP) / 100)
00134 
00135 /*
00136  * Max age for locks on clients.
00137  */
00138 #define LDLM_POOL_MAX_AGE (36000)
00139 
00140 /*
00141  * The granularity of SLV calculation.
00142  */
00143 #define LDLM_POOL_SLV_SHIFT (10)
00144 
00145 extern struct proc_dir_entry *ldlm_ns_proc_dir;
00146 
00147 static inline __u64 dru(__u64 val, __u32 shift, int round_up)
00148 {
00149         return (val + (round_up ? (1 << shift) - 1 : 0)) >> shift;
00150 }
00151 
00152 static inline __u64 ldlm_pool_slv_max(__u32 L)
00153 {
00154         /*
00155          * Allow to have all locks for 1 client for 10 hrs.
00156          * Formula is the following: limit * 10h / 1 client.
00157          */
00158         __u64 lim = (__u64)L *  LDLM_POOL_MAX_AGE / 1;
00159         return lim;
00160 }
00161 
00162 static inline __u64 ldlm_pool_slv_min(__u32 L)
00163 {
00164         return 1;
00165 }
00166 
00167 enum {
00168         LDLM_POOL_FIRST_STAT = 0,
00169         LDLM_POOL_GRANTED_STAT = LDLM_POOL_FIRST_STAT,
00170         LDLM_POOL_GRANT_STAT,
00171         LDLM_POOL_CANCEL_STAT,
00172         LDLM_POOL_GRANT_RATE_STAT,
00173         LDLM_POOL_CANCEL_RATE_STAT,
00174         LDLM_POOL_GRANT_PLAN_STAT,
00175         LDLM_POOL_SLV_STAT,
00176         LDLM_POOL_SHRINK_REQTD_STAT,
00177         LDLM_POOL_SHRINK_FREED_STAT,
00178         LDLM_POOL_RECALC_STAT,
00179         LDLM_POOL_TIMING_STAT,
00180         LDLM_POOL_LAST_STAT
00181 };

00183 static inline struct ldlm_namespace *ldlm_pl2ns(struct ldlm_pool *pl)
00184 {
00185         return container_of(pl, struct ldlm_namespace, ns_pool);
00186 }
00187 
00192 static inline int ldlm_pool_t2gsp(unsigned int t)
00193 {
00194         /*
00195          * This yields 1% grant step for anything below LDLM_POOL_GSP_STEP
00196          * and up to 30% for anything higher than LDLM_POOL_GSP_STEP.
00197          *
00198          * How this will affect execution is the following:
00199          *
00200          * - for thread period 1s we will have grant_step 1% which good from
00201          * pov of taking some load off from server and push it out to clients.
00202          * This is like that because 1% for grant_step means that server will
00203          * not allow clients to get lots of locks in short period of time and
00204          * keep all old locks in their caches. Clients will always have to
00205          * get some locks back if they want to take some new;
00206          *
00207          * - for thread period 10s (which is default) we will have 23% which
00208          * means that clients will have enough of room to take some new locks
00209          * without getting some back. All locks from this 23% which were not
00210          * taken by clients in current period will contribute in SLV growing.
00211          * SLV growing means more locks cached on clients until limit or grant
00212          * plan is reached.
00213          */
00214         return LDLM_POOL_MAX_GSP -
00215                 ((LDLM_POOL_MAX_GSP - LDLM_POOL_MIN_GSP) >>
00216                  (t >> LDLM_POOL_GSP_STEP_SHIFT));
00217 }
00218 
00219 static inline int ldlm_pool_granted(struct ldlm_pool *pl)
00220 {
00221         return atomic_read(&pl->pl_granted);
00222 }
00223 
00229 static void ldlm_pool_recalc_grant_plan(struct ldlm_pool *pl)
00230 {
00231         int granted, grant_step, limit;
00232 
00233         limit = ldlm_pool_get_limit(pl);
00234         granted = ldlm_pool_granted(pl);
00235 
00236         grant_step = ldlm_pool_t2gsp(pl->pl_recalc_period);
00237         grant_step = ((limit - granted) * grant_step) / 100;
00238         pl->pl_grant_plan = granted + grant_step;
00239         limit = (limit * 5) >> 2;
00240         if (pl->pl_grant_plan > limit)
00241                 pl->pl_grant_plan = limit;
00242 }
00243 
00249 static void ldlm_pool_recalc_slv(struct ldlm_pool *pl)
00250 {
00251         int granted;
00252         int grant_plan;
00253         int round_up;
00254         __u64 slv;
00255         __u64 slv_factor;
00256         __u64 grant_usage;
00257         __u32 limit;
00258 
00259         slv = pl->pl_server_lock_volume;
00260         grant_plan = pl->pl_grant_plan;
00261         limit = ldlm_pool_get_limit(pl);
00262         granted = ldlm_pool_granted(pl);
00263         round_up = granted < limit;
00264 
00265         grant_usage = max_t(int, limit - (granted - grant_plan), 1);
00266 
00267         /*
00268          * Find out SLV change factor which is the ratio of grant usage
00269          * from limit. SLV changes as fast as the ratio of grant plan
00270          * consumption. The more locks from grant plan are not consumed
00271          * by clients in last interval (idle time), the faster grows
00272          * SLV. And the opposite, the more grant plan is over-consumed
00273          * (load time) the faster drops SLV.
00274          */
00275         slv_factor = (grant_usage << LDLM_POOL_SLV_SHIFT);
00276         do_div(slv_factor, limit);
00277         slv = slv * slv_factor;
00278         slv = dru(slv, LDLM_POOL_SLV_SHIFT, round_up);
00279 
00280         if (slv > ldlm_pool_slv_max(limit)) {
00281                 slv = ldlm_pool_slv_max(limit);
00282         } else if (slv < ldlm_pool_slv_min(limit)) {
00283                 slv = ldlm_pool_slv_min(limit);
00284         }
00285 
00286         pl->pl_server_lock_volume = slv;
00287 }
00288 
00294 static void ldlm_pool_recalc_stats(struct ldlm_pool *pl)
00295 {
00296         int grant_plan = pl->pl_grant_plan;
00297         __u64 slv = pl->pl_server_lock_volume;
00298         int granted = ldlm_pool_granted(pl);
00299         int grant_rate = atomic_read(&pl->pl_grant_rate);
00300         int cancel_rate = atomic_read(&pl->pl_cancel_rate);
00301 
00302         lprocfs_counter_add(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_SLV_STAT,
00303                             slv);
00304         lprocfs_counter_add(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_GRANTED_STAT,
00305                             granted);
00306         lprocfs_counter_add(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_GRANT_RATE_STAT,
00307                             grant_rate);
00308         lprocfs_counter_add(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_GRANT_PLAN_STAT,
00309                             grant_plan);
00310         lprocfs_counter_add(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_CANCEL_RATE_STAT,
00311                             cancel_rate);
00312 }
00313 
00317 static void ldlm_srv_pool_push_slv(struct ldlm_pool *pl)
00318 {
00319         struct obd_device *obd;
00320 
00321         /*
00322          * Set new SLV in obd field for using it later without accessing the
00323          * pool. This is required to avoid race between sending reply to client
00324          * with new SLV and cleanup server stack in which we can't guarantee
00325          * that namespace is still alive. We know only that obd is alive as
00326          * long as valid export is alive.
00327          */
00328         obd = ldlm_pl2ns(pl)->ns_obd;
00329         LASSERT(obd != NULL);
00330         write_lock(&obd->obd_pool_lock);
00331         obd->obd_pool_slv = pl->pl_server_lock_volume;
00332         write_unlock(&obd->obd_pool_lock);
00333 }
00334 
00340 static int ldlm_srv_pool_recalc(struct ldlm_pool *pl)
00341 {
00342         time_t recalc_interval_sec;
00343         ENTRY;
00344 
00345         recalc_interval_sec = cfs_time_current_sec() - pl->pl_recalc_time;
00346         if (recalc_interval_sec < pl->pl_recalc_period)
00347                 RETURN(0);
00348 
00349         spin_lock(&pl->pl_lock);
00350         recalc_interval_sec = cfs_time_current_sec() - pl->pl_recalc_time;
00351         if (recalc_interval_sec < pl->pl_recalc_period) {
00352                 spin_unlock(&pl->pl_lock);
00353                 RETURN(0);
00354         }
00355         /*
00356          * Recalc SLV after last period. This should be done
00357          * _before_ recalculating new grant plan.
00358          */
00359         ldlm_pool_recalc_slv(pl);
00360 
00361         /*
00362          * Make sure that pool informed obd of last SLV changes.
00363          */
00364         ldlm_srv_pool_push_slv(pl);
00365 
00366         /*
00367          * Update grant_plan for new period.
00368          */
00369         ldlm_pool_recalc_grant_plan(pl);
00370 
00371         pl->pl_recalc_time = cfs_time_current_sec();
00372         lprocfs_counter_add(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_TIMING_STAT,
00373                             recalc_interval_sec);
00374         spin_unlock(&pl->pl_lock);
00375         RETURN(0);
00376 }
00377 
00386 static int ldlm_srv_pool_shrink(struct ldlm_pool *pl,
00387                                 int nr,  gfp_t gfp_mask)
00388 {
00389         __u32 limit;
00390 
00391         /*
00392          * VM is asking how many entries may be potentially freed.
00393          */
00394         if (nr == 0)
00395                 return ldlm_pool_granted(pl);
00396 
00397         /*
00398          * Client already canceled locks but server is already in shrinker
00399          * and can't cancel anything. Let's catch this race.
00400          */
00401         if (ldlm_pool_granted(pl) == 0)
00402                 RETURN(0);
00403 
00404         spin_lock(&pl->pl_lock);
00405 
00406         /*
00407          * We want shrinker to possibly cause cancellation of @nr locks from
00408          * clients or grant approximately @nr locks smaller next intervals.
00409          *
00410          * This is why we decreased SLV by @nr. This effect will only be as
00411          * long as one re-calc interval (1s these days) and this should be
00412          * enough to pass this decreased SLV to all clients. On next recalc
00413          * interval pool will either increase SLV if locks load is not high
00414          * or will keep on same level or even decrease again, thus, shrinker
00415          * decreased SLV will affect next recalc intervals and this way will
00416          * make locking load lower.
00417          */
00418         if (nr < pl->pl_server_lock_volume) {
00419                 pl->pl_server_lock_volume = pl->pl_server_lock_volume - nr;
00420         } else {
00421                 limit = ldlm_pool_get_limit(pl);
00422                 pl->pl_server_lock_volume = ldlm_pool_slv_min(limit);
00423         }
00424 
00425         /*
00426          * Make sure that pool informed obd of last SLV changes.
00427          */
00428         ldlm_srv_pool_push_slv(pl);
00429         spin_unlock(&pl->pl_lock);
00430 
00431         /*
00432          * We did not really free any memory here so far, it only will be
00433          * freed later may be, so that we return 0 to not confuse VM.
00434          */
00435         return 0;
00436 }
00437 
00441 static int ldlm_srv_pool_setup(struct ldlm_pool *pl, int limit)
00442 {
00443         struct obd_device *obd;
00444 
00445         obd = ldlm_pl2ns(pl)->ns_obd;
00446         LASSERT(obd != NULL && obd != LP_POISON);
00447         LASSERT(obd->obd_type != LP_POISON);
00448         write_lock(&obd->obd_pool_lock);
00449         obd->obd_pool_limit = limit;
00450         write_unlock(&obd->obd_pool_lock);
00451 
00452         ldlm_pool_set_limit(pl, limit);
00453         return 0;
00454 }
00455 
00459 static void ldlm_cli_pool_pop_slv(struct ldlm_pool *pl)
00460 {
00461         struct obd_device *obd;
00462 
00463         /*
00464          * Get new SLV and Limit from obd which is updated with coming
00465          * RPCs.
00466          */
00467         obd = ldlm_pl2ns(pl)->ns_obd;
00468         LASSERT(obd != NULL);
00469         read_lock(&obd->obd_pool_lock);
00470         pl->pl_server_lock_volume = obd->obd_pool_slv;
00471         ldlm_pool_set_limit(pl, obd->obd_pool_limit);
00472         read_unlock(&obd->obd_pool_lock);
00473 }
00474 
00478 static int ldlm_cli_pool_recalc(struct ldlm_pool *pl)
00479 {
00480         time_t recalc_interval_sec;
00481         int ret;
00482         ENTRY;
00483 
00484         recalc_interval_sec = cfs_time_current_sec() - pl->pl_recalc_time;
00485         if (recalc_interval_sec < pl->pl_recalc_period)
00486                 RETURN(0);
00487 
00488         spin_lock(&pl->pl_lock);
00489         /*
00490          * Check if we need to recalc lists now.
00491          */
00492         recalc_interval_sec = cfs_time_current_sec() - pl->pl_recalc_time;
00493         if (recalc_interval_sec < pl->pl_recalc_period) {
00494                 spin_unlock(&pl->pl_lock);
00495                 RETURN(0);
00496         }
00497 
00498         /*
00499          * Make sure that pool knows last SLV and Limit from obd.
00500          */
00501         ldlm_cli_pool_pop_slv(pl);
00502         spin_unlock(&pl->pl_lock);
00503 
00504         /*
00505          * Do not cancel locks in case lru resize is disabled for this ns.
00506          */
00507         if (!ns_connect_lru_resize(ldlm_pl2ns(pl)))
00508                 GOTO(out, ret = 0);
00509 
00510         /*
00511          * In the time of canceling locks on client we do not need to maintain
00512          * sharp timing, we only want to cancel locks asap according to new SLV.
00513          * It may be called when SLV has changed much, this is why we do not
00514          * take into account pl->pl_recalc_time here.
00515          */
00516         ret = ldlm_cancel_lru(ldlm_pl2ns(pl), 0, LCF_ASYNC,
00517                               LDLM_LRU_FLAG_LRUR);
00518 
00519 out:
00520         spin_lock(&pl->pl_lock);
00521         /*
00522          * Time of LRU resizing might be longer than period,
00523          * so update after LRU resizing rather than before it.
00524          */
00525         pl->pl_recalc_time = cfs_time_current_sec();
00526         lprocfs_counter_add(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_TIMING_STAT,
00527                             recalc_interval_sec);
00528         spin_unlock(&pl->pl_lock);
00529         RETURN(ret);
00530 }
00531 
00537 static int ldlm_cli_pool_shrink(struct ldlm_pool *pl,
00538                                 int nr, gfp_t gfp_mask)
00539 {
00540         struct ldlm_namespace *ns;
00541         int unused;
00542 
00543         ns = ldlm_pl2ns(pl);
00544 
00545         /*
00546          * Do not cancel locks in case lru resize is disabled for this ns.
00547          */
00548         if (!ns_connect_lru_resize(ns))
00549                 RETURN(0);
00550 
00551         /*
00552          * Make sure that pool knows last SLV and Limit from obd.
00553          */
00554         ldlm_cli_pool_pop_slv(pl);
00555 
00556         spin_lock(&ns->ns_lock);
00557         unused = ns->ns_nr_unused;
00558         spin_unlock(&ns->ns_lock);
00559 
00560         if (nr == 0)
00561                 return (unused / 100) * sysctl_vfs_cache_pressure;
00562         else
00563                 return ldlm_cancel_lru(ns, nr, LCF_ASYNC, LDLM_LRU_FLAG_SHRINK);
00564 }
00565 
00566 static struct ldlm_pool_ops ldlm_srv_pool_ops = {
00567         .po_recalc = ldlm_srv_pool_recalc,
00568         .po_shrink = ldlm_srv_pool_shrink,
00569         .po_setup  = ldlm_srv_pool_setup
00570 };
00571 
00572 static struct ldlm_pool_ops ldlm_cli_pool_ops = {
00573         .po_recalc = ldlm_cli_pool_recalc,
00574         .po_shrink = ldlm_cli_pool_shrink
00575 };
00576 
00581 int ldlm_pool_recalc(struct ldlm_pool *pl)
00582 {
00583         time_t recalc_interval_sec;
00584         int count;
00585 
00586         recalc_interval_sec = cfs_time_current_sec() - pl->pl_recalc_time;
00587         if (recalc_interval_sec > 0) {
00588                 spin_lock(&pl->pl_lock);
00589                 recalc_interval_sec = cfs_time_current_sec() -
00590                         pl->pl_recalc_time;
00591 
00592                 if (recalc_interval_sec > 0) {
00593                         /*
00594                          * Update pool statistics every 1s.
00595                          */
00596                         ldlm_pool_recalc_stats(pl);
00597 
00598                         /*
00599                          * Zero out all rates and speed for the last period.
00600                          */
00601                         atomic_set(&pl->pl_grant_rate, 0);
00602                         atomic_set(&pl->pl_cancel_rate, 0);
00603                 }
00604                 spin_unlock(&pl->pl_lock);
00605         }
00606 
00607         if (pl->pl_ops->po_recalc != NULL) {
00608                 count = pl->pl_ops->po_recalc(pl);
00609                 lprocfs_counter_add(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_RECALC_STAT,
00610                                     count);
00611         }
00612 
00613         recalc_interval_sec = pl->pl_recalc_time - cfs_time_current_sec() +
00614                               pl->pl_recalc_period;
00615         if (recalc_interval_sec <= 0) {
00616                 /* DEBUG: should be re-removed after LU-4536 is fixed */
00617                 CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "%s: Negative interval(%ld), "
00618                        "too short period(%ld)\n",
00619                        pl->pl_name, recalc_interval_sec,
00620                        pl->pl_recalc_period);
00621 
00622                 /* Prevent too frequent recalculation. */
00623                 recalc_interval_sec = 1;
00624         }
00625 
00626         return recalc_interval_sec;
00627 }
00628 
00633 int ldlm_pool_shrink(struct ldlm_pool *pl, int nr, gfp_t gfp_mask)
00634 {
00635         int cancel = 0;
00636 
00637         if (pl->pl_ops->po_shrink != NULL) {
00638                 cancel = pl->pl_ops->po_shrink(pl, nr, gfp_mask);
00639                 if (nr > 0) {
00640                         lprocfs_counter_add(pl->pl_stats,
00641                                             LDLM_POOL_SHRINK_REQTD_STAT,
00642                                             nr);
00643                         lprocfs_counter_add(pl->pl_stats,
00644                                             LDLM_POOL_SHRINK_FREED_STAT,
00645                                             cancel);
00646                         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "%s: request to shrink %d locks, "
00647                                "shrunk %d\n", pl->pl_name, nr, cancel);
00648                 }
00649         }
00650         return cancel;
00651 }
00652 
00659 int ldlm_pool_setup(struct ldlm_pool *pl, int limit)
00660 {
00661         if (pl->pl_ops->po_setup != NULL)
00662                 return(pl->pl_ops->po_setup(pl, limit));
00663         return 0;
00664 }
00665 
00666 static int lprocfs_pool_state_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *unused)
00667 {
00668         int granted, grant_rate, cancel_rate, grant_step;
00669         int grant_speed, grant_plan, lvf;
00670         struct ldlm_pool *pl = m->private;
00671         __u64 slv, clv;
00672         __u32 limit;
00673 
00674         spin_lock(&pl->pl_lock);
00675         slv = pl->pl_server_lock_volume;
00676         clv = pl->pl_client_lock_volume;
00677         limit = ldlm_pool_get_limit(pl);
00678         grant_plan = pl->pl_grant_plan;
00679         granted = ldlm_pool_granted(pl);
00680         grant_rate = atomic_read(&pl->pl_grant_rate);
00681         cancel_rate = atomic_read(&pl->pl_cancel_rate);
00682         grant_speed = grant_rate - cancel_rate;
00683         lvf = atomic_read(&pl->pl_lock_volume_factor);
00684         grant_step = ldlm_pool_t2gsp(pl->pl_recalc_period);
00685         spin_unlock(&pl->pl_lock);
00686 
00687         seq_printf(m, "LDLM pool state (%s):\n"
00688                    "  SLV: "LPU64"\n"
00689                    "  CLV: "LPU64"\n"
00690                    "  LVF: %d\n",
00691                    pl->pl_name, slv, clv, lvf);
00692 
00693         if (ns_is_server(ldlm_pl2ns(pl))) {
00694                 seq_printf(m, "  GSP: %d%%\n", grant_step);
00695                 seq_printf(m, "  GP:  %d\n", grant_plan);
00696         }
00697 
00698         seq_printf(m, "  GR:  %d\n  CR:  %d\n  GS:  %d\n  G:   %d\n  L:   %d\n",
00699                    grant_rate, cancel_rate, grant_speed,
00700                    granted, limit);
00701         return 0;
00702 }
00703 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS_RO(lprocfs_pool_state);
00704 
00705 static int lprocfs_grant_speed_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *unused)
00706 {
00707         struct ldlm_pool *pl = m->private;
00708         int               grant_speed;
00709 
00710         spin_lock(&pl->pl_lock);
00711         /* serialize with ldlm_pool_recalc */
00712         grant_speed = atomic_read(&pl->pl_grant_rate) -
00713                         atomic_read(&pl->pl_cancel_rate);
00714         spin_unlock(&pl->pl_lock);
00715         return lprocfs_uint_seq_show(m, &grant_speed);
00716 }
00717 
00718 LDLM_POOL_PROC_READER_SEQ_SHOW(grant_plan, int);
00719 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS_RO(lprocfs_grant_plan);
00720 
00721 LDLM_POOL_PROC_READER_SEQ_SHOW(recalc_period, int);
00722 LDLM_POOL_PROC_WRITER(recalc_period, int);
00723 static ssize_t lprocfs_recalc_period_seq_write(struct file *file,
00724                                                const char __user *buf,
00725                                                size_t len, loff_t *off)
00726 {
00727         struct seq_file *seq = file->private_data;
00728 
00729         return lprocfs_wr_recalc_period(file, buf, len, seq->private);
00730 }
00731 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(lprocfs_recalc_period);
00732 
00733 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS_RO_TYPE(ldlm_pool, u64);
00734 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS_RO_TYPE(ldlm_pool, atomic);
00735 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS_RW_TYPE(ldlm_pool_rw, atomic);
00736 
00737 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS_RO(lprocfs_grant_speed);
00738 
00739 static int ldlm_pool_proc_init(struct ldlm_pool *pl)
00740 {
00741         struct ldlm_namespace *ns = ldlm_pl2ns(pl);
00742         struct proc_dir_entry *parent_ns_proc;
00743         struct lprocfs_vars pool_vars[2];
00744         char *var_name = NULL;
00745         int rc = 0;
00746         ENTRY;
00747 
00748         OBD_ALLOC(var_name, MAX_STRING_SIZE + 1);
00749         if (!var_name)
00750                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00751 
00752         parent_ns_proc = ns->ns_proc_dir_entry;
00753         if (parent_ns_proc == NULL) {
00754                 CERROR("%s: proc entry is not initialized\n",
00755                        ldlm_ns_name(ns));
00756                 GOTO(out_free_name, rc = -EINVAL);
00757         }
00758         pl->pl_proc_dir = lprocfs_register("pool", parent_ns_proc,
00759                                            NULL, NULL);
00760         if (IS_ERR(pl->pl_proc_dir)) {
00761                 rc = PTR_ERR(pl->pl_proc_dir);
00762                 pl->pl_proc_dir = NULL;
00763                 CERROR("%s: cannot create 'pool' proc entry: rc = %d\n",
00764                        ldlm_ns_name(ns), rc);
00765                 GOTO(out_free_name, rc);
00766         }
00767 
00768         var_name[MAX_STRING_SIZE] = '\0';
00769         memset(pool_vars, 0, sizeof(pool_vars));
00770         pool_vars[0].name = var_name;
00771 
00772         ldlm_add_var(&pool_vars[0], pl->pl_proc_dir, "server_lock_volume",
00773                      &pl->pl_server_lock_volume, &ldlm_pool_u64_fops);
00774         ldlm_add_var(&pool_vars[0], pl->pl_proc_dir, "limit", &pl->pl_limit,
00775                      &ldlm_pool_rw_atomic_fops);
00776         ldlm_add_var(&pool_vars[0], pl->pl_proc_dir, "granted",
00777                      &pl->pl_granted, &ldlm_pool_atomic_fops);
00778         ldlm_add_var(&pool_vars[0], pl->pl_proc_dir, "grant_speed", pl,
00779                      &lprocfs_grant_speed_fops);
00780         ldlm_add_var(&pool_vars[0], pl->pl_proc_dir, "cancel_rate",
00781                      &pl->pl_cancel_rate, &ldlm_pool_atomic_fops);
00782         ldlm_add_var(&pool_vars[0], pl->pl_proc_dir, "grant_rate",
00783                      &pl->pl_grant_rate, &ldlm_pool_atomic_fops);
00784         ldlm_add_var(&pool_vars[0], pl->pl_proc_dir, "grant_plan", pl,
00785                      &lprocfs_grant_plan_fops);
00786         ldlm_add_var(&pool_vars[0], pl->pl_proc_dir, "recalc_period",
00787                      pl, &lprocfs_recalc_period_fops);
00788         ldlm_add_var(&pool_vars[0], pl->pl_proc_dir, "lock_volume_factor",
00789                      &pl->pl_lock_volume_factor, &ldlm_pool_rw_atomic_fops);
00790         ldlm_add_var(&pool_vars[0], pl->pl_proc_dir, "state", pl,
00791                      &lprocfs_pool_state_fops);
00792 
00793         pl->pl_stats = lprocfs_alloc_stats(LDLM_POOL_LAST_STAT -
00794                                            LDLM_POOL_FIRST_STAT, 0);
00795         if (!pl->pl_stats)
00796                 GOTO(out_free_name, rc = -ENOMEM);
00797 
00798         lprocfs_counter_init(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_GRANTED_STAT,
00799                              LPROCFS_CNTR_AVGMINMAX | LPROCFS_CNTR_STDDEV,
00800                              "granted", "locks");
00801         lprocfs_counter_init(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_GRANT_STAT,
00802                              LPROCFS_CNTR_AVGMINMAX | LPROCFS_CNTR_STDDEV,
00803                              "grant", "locks");
00804         lprocfs_counter_init(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_CANCEL_STAT,
00805                              LPROCFS_CNTR_AVGMINMAX | LPROCFS_CNTR_STDDEV,
00806                              "cancel", "locks");
00807         lprocfs_counter_init(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_GRANT_RATE_STAT,
00808                              LPROCFS_CNTR_AVGMINMAX | LPROCFS_CNTR_STDDEV,
00809                              "grant_rate", "locks/s");
00810         lprocfs_counter_init(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_CANCEL_RATE_STAT,
00811                              LPROCFS_CNTR_AVGMINMAX | LPROCFS_CNTR_STDDEV,
00812                              "cancel_rate", "locks/s");
00813         lprocfs_counter_init(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_GRANT_PLAN_STAT,
00814                              LPROCFS_CNTR_AVGMINMAX | LPROCFS_CNTR_STDDEV,
00815                              "grant_plan", "locks/s");
00816         lprocfs_counter_init(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_SLV_STAT,
00817                              LPROCFS_CNTR_AVGMINMAX | LPROCFS_CNTR_STDDEV,
00818                              "slv", "slv");
00819         lprocfs_counter_init(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_SHRINK_REQTD_STAT,
00820                              LPROCFS_CNTR_AVGMINMAX | LPROCFS_CNTR_STDDEV,
00821                              "shrink_request", "locks");
00822         lprocfs_counter_init(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_SHRINK_FREED_STAT,
00823                              LPROCFS_CNTR_AVGMINMAX | LPROCFS_CNTR_STDDEV,
00824                              "shrink_freed", "locks");
00825         lprocfs_counter_init(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_RECALC_STAT,
00826                              LPROCFS_CNTR_AVGMINMAX | LPROCFS_CNTR_STDDEV,
00827                              "recalc_freed", "locks");
00828         lprocfs_counter_init(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_TIMING_STAT,
00829                              LPROCFS_CNTR_AVGMINMAX | LPROCFS_CNTR_STDDEV,
00830                              "recalc_timing", "sec");
00831         rc = lprocfs_register_stats(pl->pl_proc_dir, "stats", pl->pl_stats);
00832 
00833         EXIT;
00834 out_free_name:
00835         OBD_FREE(var_name, MAX_STRING_SIZE + 1);
00836         return rc;
00837 }
00838 
00839 static void ldlm_pool_proc_fini(struct ldlm_pool *pl)
00840 {
00841         if (pl->pl_stats != NULL) {
00842                 lprocfs_free_stats(&pl->pl_stats);
00843                 pl->pl_stats = NULL;
00844         }
00845         if (pl->pl_proc_dir != NULL) {
00846                 lprocfs_remove(&pl->pl_proc_dir);
00847                 pl->pl_proc_dir = NULL;
00848         }
00849 }
00850 
00851 int ldlm_pool_init(struct ldlm_pool *pl, struct ldlm_namespace *ns,
00852                    int idx, enum ldlm_side client)
00853 {
00854         int rc;
00855         ENTRY;
00856 
00857         spin_lock_init(&pl->pl_lock);
00858         atomic_set(&pl->pl_granted, 0);
00859         pl->pl_recalc_time = cfs_time_current_sec();
00860         atomic_set(&pl->pl_lock_volume_factor, 1);
00861 
00862         atomic_set(&pl->pl_grant_rate, 0);
00863         atomic_set(&pl->pl_cancel_rate, 0);
00864         pl->pl_grant_plan = LDLM_POOL_GP(LDLM_POOL_HOST_L);
00865 
00866         snprintf(pl->pl_name, sizeof(pl->pl_name), "ldlm-pool-%s-%d",
00867                  ldlm_ns_name(ns), idx);
00868 
00869         if (client == LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER) {
00870                 pl->pl_ops = &ldlm_srv_pool_ops;
00871                 ldlm_pool_set_limit(pl, LDLM_POOL_HOST_L);
00872                 pl->pl_recalc_period = LDLM_POOL_SRV_DEF_RECALC_PERIOD;
00873                 pl->pl_server_lock_volume = ldlm_pool_slv_max(LDLM_POOL_HOST_L);
00874         } else {
00875                 ldlm_pool_set_limit(pl, 1);
00876                 pl->pl_server_lock_volume = 0;
00877                 pl->pl_ops = &ldlm_cli_pool_ops;
00878                 pl->pl_recalc_period = LDLM_POOL_CLI_DEF_RECALC_PERIOD;
00879         }
00880         pl->pl_client_lock_volume = 0;
00881         rc = ldlm_pool_proc_init(pl);
00882         if (rc)
00883                 RETURN(rc);
00884 
00885         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "Lock pool %s is initialized\n", pl->pl_name);
00886 
00887         RETURN(rc);
00888 }
00889 
00890 void ldlm_pool_fini(struct ldlm_pool *pl)
00891 {
00892         ENTRY;
00893         ldlm_pool_proc_fini(pl);
00894 
00895         /*
00896          * Pool should not be used after this point. We can't free it here as
00897          * it lives in struct ldlm_namespace, but still interested in catching
00898          * any abnormal using cases.
00899          */
00900         POISON(pl, 0x5a, sizeof(*pl));
00901         EXIT;
00902 }
00903 
00907 void ldlm_pool_add(struct ldlm_pool *pl, struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00908 {
00909         /*
00910          * FLOCK locks are special in a sense that they are almost never
00911          * cancelled, instead special kind of lock is used to drop them.
00912          * also there is no LRU for flock locks, so no point in tracking
00913          * them anyway.
00914          *
00915          * PLAIN locks are used by config and quota, the quantity is small
00916          * and usually they are not in LRU.
00917          */
00918         if (lock->l_resource->lr_type == LDLM_FLOCK ||
00919             lock->l_resource->lr_type == LDLM_PLAIN)
00920                 return;
00921 
00922         ldlm_reclaim_add(lock);
00923 
00924         atomic_inc(&pl->pl_granted);
00925         atomic_inc(&pl->pl_grant_rate);
00926         lprocfs_counter_incr(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_GRANT_STAT);
00927         /*
00928          * Do not do pool recalc for client side as all locks which
00929          * potentially may be canceled has already been packed into
00930          * enqueue/cancel rpc. Also we do not want to run out of stack
00931          * with too long call paths.
00932          */
00933         if (ns_is_server(ldlm_pl2ns(pl)))
00934                 ldlm_pool_recalc(pl);
00935 }
00936 
00940 void ldlm_pool_del(struct ldlm_pool *pl, struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00941 {
00942         /*
00943          * Filter out FLOCK & PLAIN locks. Read above comment in
00944          * ldlm_pool_add().
00945          */
00946         if (lock->l_resource->lr_type == LDLM_FLOCK ||
00947             lock->l_resource->lr_type == LDLM_PLAIN)
00948                 return;
00949 
00950         ldlm_reclaim_del(lock);
00951 
00952         LASSERT(atomic_read(&pl->pl_granted) > 0);
00953         atomic_dec(&pl->pl_granted);
00954         atomic_inc(&pl->pl_cancel_rate);
00955 
00956         lprocfs_counter_incr(pl->pl_stats, LDLM_POOL_CANCEL_STAT);
00957 
00958         if (ns_is_server(ldlm_pl2ns(pl)))
00959                 ldlm_pool_recalc(pl);
00960 }
00961 
00967 __u64 ldlm_pool_get_slv(struct ldlm_pool *pl)
00968 {
00969         __u64 slv;
00970         spin_lock(&pl->pl_lock);
00971         slv = pl->pl_server_lock_volume;
00972         spin_unlock(&pl->pl_lock);
00973         return slv;
00974 }
00975 
00981 void ldlm_pool_set_slv(struct ldlm_pool *pl, __u64 slv)
00982 {
00983         spin_lock(&pl->pl_lock);
00984         pl->pl_server_lock_volume = slv;
00985         spin_unlock(&pl->pl_lock);
00986 }
00987 
00993 __u64 ldlm_pool_get_clv(struct ldlm_pool *pl)
00994 {
00995         __u64 slv;
00996         spin_lock(&pl->pl_lock);
00997         slv = pl->pl_client_lock_volume;
00998         spin_unlock(&pl->pl_lock);
00999         return slv;
01000 }
01001 
01007 void ldlm_pool_set_clv(struct ldlm_pool *pl, __u64 clv)
01008 {
01009         spin_lock(&pl->pl_lock);
01010         pl->pl_client_lock_volume = clv;
01011         spin_unlock(&pl->pl_lock);
01012 }
01013 
01017 __u32 ldlm_pool_get_limit(struct ldlm_pool *pl)
01018 {
01019         return atomic_read(&pl->pl_limit);
01020 }
01021 
01025 void ldlm_pool_set_limit(struct ldlm_pool *pl, __u32 limit)
01026 {
01027         atomic_set(&pl->pl_limit, limit);
01028 }
01029 
01033 __u32 ldlm_pool_get_lvf(struct ldlm_pool *pl)
01034 {
01035         return atomic_read(&pl->pl_lock_volume_factor);
01036 }
01037 
01038 static struct ptlrpc_thread *ldlm_pools_thread;
01039 static struct shrinker *ldlm_pools_srv_shrinker;
01040 static struct shrinker *ldlm_pools_cli_shrinker;
01041 static struct completion ldlm_pools_comp;
01042 
01043 /*
01044 * count locks from all namespaces (if possible). Returns number of
01045 * cached locks.
01046 */
01047 static unsigned long ldlm_pools_count(enum ldlm_side client, gfp_t gfp_mask)
01048 {
01049         unsigned long total = 0;
01050         int nr_ns;
01051         struct ldlm_namespace *ns;
01052         struct ldlm_namespace *ns_old = NULL; /* loop detection */
01053         void *cookie;
01054 
01055         if (client == LDLM_NAMESPACE_CLIENT && !(gfp_mask & __GFP_FS))
01056                 return 0;
01057 
01058         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "Request to count %s locks from all pools\n",
01059                client == LDLM_NAMESPACE_CLIENT ? "client" : "server");
01060 
01061         cookie = cl_env_reenter();
01062 
01063         /*
01064          * Find out how many resources we may release.
01065          */
01066         for (nr_ns = ldlm_namespace_nr_read(client);
01067              nr_ns > 0; nr_ns--) {
01068                 mutex_lock(ldlm_namespace_lock(client));
01069                 if (list_empty(ldlm_namespace_list(client))) {
01070                         mutex_unlock(ldlm_namespace_lock(client));
01071                         cl_env_reexit(cookie);
01072                         return 0;
01073                 }
01074                 ns = ldlm_namespace_first_locked(client);
01075 
01076                 if (ns == ns_old) {
01077                         mutex_unlock(ldlm_namespace_lock(client));
01078                         break;
01079                 }
01080 
01081                 if (ldlm_ns_empty(ns)) {
01082                         ldlm_namespace_move_to_inactive_locked(ns, client);
01083                         mutex_unlock(ldlm_namespace_lock(client));
01084                         continue;
01085                 }
01086 
01087                 if (ns_old == NULL)
01088                         ns_old = ns;
01089 
01090                 ldlm_namespace_get(ns);
01091                 ldlm_namespace_move_to_active_locked(ns, client);
01092                 mutex_unlock(ldlm_namespace_lock(client));
01093                 total += ldlm_pool_shrink(&ns->ns_pool, 0, gfp_mask);
01094                 ldlm_namespace_put(ns);
01095         }
01096 
01097         cl_env_reexit(cookie);
01098         return total;
01099 }
01100 
01101 static unsigned long ldlm_pools_scan(enum ldlm_side client, int nr,
01102                                      gfp_t gfp_mask)
01103 {
01104         unsigned long freed = 0;
01105         int tmp, nr_ns;
01106         struct ldlm_namespace *ns;
01107         void *cookie;
01108 
01109         if (client == LDLM_NAMESPACE_CLIENT && !(gfp_mask & __GFP_FS))
01110                 return -1;
01111 
01112         cookie = cl_env_reenter();
01113 
01114         /*
01115          * Shrink at least ldlm_namespace_nr_read(client) namespaces.
01116          */
01117         for (tmp = nr_ns = ldlm_namespace_nr_read(client);
01118              tmp > 0; tmp--) {
01119                 int cancel, nr_locks;
01120 
01121                 /*
01122                  * Do not call shrink under ldlm_namespace_lock(client)
01123                 */
01124                 mutex_lock(ldlm_namespace_lock(client));
01125                 if (list_empty(ldlm_namespace_list(client))) {
01126                         mutex_unlock(ldlm_namespace_lock(client));
01127                         break;
01128                 }
01129                 ns = ldlm_namespace_first_locked(client);
01130                 ldlm_namespace_get(ns);
01131                 ldlm_namespace_move_to_active_locked(ns, client);
01132                 mutex_unlock(ldlm_namespace_lock(client));
01133 
01134                 nr_locks = ldlm_pool_granted(&ns->ns_pool);
01135                 /*
01136                  * We use to shrink propotionally but with new shrinker API,
01137                  * we lost the total number of freeable locks.
01138                  */
01139                 cancel = 1 + min_t(int, nr_locks, nr / nr_ns);
01140                 freed += ldlm_pool_shrink(&ns->ns_pool, cancel, gfp_mask);
01141                 ldlm_namespace_put(ns);
01142         }
01143         cl_env_reexit(cookie);
01144         /*
01145          * we only decrease the SLV in server pools shrinker, return
01146          * SHRINK_STOP to kernel to avoid needless loop. LU-1128
01147          */
01148         return (client == LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER) ? SHRINK_STOP : freed;
01149 }
01150 
01151 #ifdef HAVE_SHRINKER_COUNT
01152 static unsigned long ldlm_pools_srv_count(struct shrinker *s,
01153                                           struct shrink_control *sc)
01154 {
01155         return ldlm_pools_count(LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER, sc->gfp_mask);
01156 }
01157 
01158 static unsigned long ldlm_pools_srv_scan(struct shrinker *s,
01159                                          struct shrink_control *sc)
01160 {
01161         return ldlm_pools_scan(LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER, sc->nr_to_scan,
01162                                sc->gfp_mask);
01163 }
01164 
01165 static unsigned long ldlm_pools_cli_count(struct shrinker *s, struct shrink_control *sc)
01166 {
01167         return ldlm_pools_count(LDLM_NAMESPACE_CLIENT, sc->gfp_mask);
01168 }
01169 
01170 static unsigned long ldlm_pools_cli_scan(struct shrinker *s,
01171                                          struct shrink_control *sc)
01172 {
01173         return ldlm_pools_scan(LDLM_NAMESPACE_CLIENT, sc->nr_to_scan,
01174                                sc->gfp_mask);
01175 }
01176 
01177 #else
01178 /*
01179  * Cancel \a nr locks from all namespaces (if possible). Returns number of
01180  * cached locks after shrink is finished. All namespaces are asked to
01181  * cancel approximately equal amount of locks to keep balancing.
01182  */
01183 static int ldlm_pools_shrink(enum ldlm_side client, int nr, gfp_t gfp_mask)
01184 {
01185         unsigned long total = 0;
01186 
01187         if (client == LDLM_NAMESPACE_CLIENT && nr != 0 &&
01188             !(gfp_mask & __GFP_FS))
01189                 return -1;
01190 
01191         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "Request to shrink %d %s locks from all pools\n",
01192                nr, client == LDLM_NAMESPACE_CLIENT ? "client" : "server");
01193 
01194         total = ldlm_pools_count(client, gfp_mask);
01195 
01196         if (nr == 0 || total == 0)
01197                 return total;
01198 
01199         return ldlm_pools_scan(client, nr, gfp_mask);
01200 }
01201 
01202 static int ldlm_pools_srv_shrink(SHRINKER_ARGS(sc, nr_to_scan, gfp_mask))
01203 {
01204         return ldlm_pools_shrink(LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER,
01205                                  shrink_param(sc, nr_to_scan),
01206                                  shrink_param(sc, gfp_mask));
01207 }
01208 
01209 static int ldlm_pools_cli_shrink(SHRINKER_ARGS(sc, nr_to_scan, gfp_mask))
01210 {
01211         return ldlm_pools_shrink(LDLM_NAMESPACE_CLIENT,
01212                                  shrink_param(sc, nr_to_scan),
01213                                  shrink_param(sc, gfp_mask));
01214 }
01215 
01216 #endif /* HAVE_SHRINKER_COUNT */
01217 
01218 int ldlm_pools_recalc(enum ldlm_side client)
01219 {
01220         unsigned long nr_l = 0, nr_p = 0, l;
01221         struct ldlm_namespace *ns;
01222         struct ldlm_namespace *ns_old = NULL;
01223         int nr, equal = 0;
01224         /* seconds of sleep if no active namespaces */
01225         int time = client ? LDLM_POOL_CLI_DEF_RECALC_PERIOD :
01226                             LDLM_POOL_SRV_DEF_RECALC_PERIOD;
01227 
01228         /*
01229          * No need to setup pool limit for client pools.
01230          */
01231         if (client == LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER) {
01232                 /*
01233                  * Check all modest namespaces first.
01234                  */
01235                 mutex_lock(ldlm_namespace_lock(client));
01236                 list_for_each_entry(ns, ldlm_namespace_list(client),
01237                                     ns_list_chain)
01238                 {
01239                         if (ns->ns_appetite != LDLM_NAMESPACE_MODEST)
01240                                 continue;
01241 
01242                         l = ldlm_pool_granted(&ns->ns_pool);
01243                         if (l == 0)
01244                                 l = 1;
01245 
01246                         /*
01247                          * Set the modest pools limit equal to their avg granted
01248                          * locks + ~6%.
01249                          */
01250                         l += dru(l, LDLM_POOLS_MODEST_MARGIN_SHIFT, 0);
01251                         ldlm_pool_setup(&ns->ns_pool, l);
01252                         nr_l += l;
01253                         nr_p++;
01254                 }
01255 
01256                 /*
01257                  * Make sure that modest namespaces did not eat more that 2/3
01258                  * of limit.
01259                  */
01260                 if (nr_l >= 2 * (LDLM_POOL_HOST_L / 3)) {
01261                         CWARN("\"Modest\" pools eat out 2/3 of server locks "
01262                               "limit (%lu of %lu). This means that you have too "
01263                               "many clients for this amount of server RAM. "
01264                               "Upgrade server!\n", nr_l, LDLM_POOL_HOST_L);
01265                         equal = 1;
01266                 }
01267 
01268                 /*
01269                  * The rest is given to greedy namespaces.
01270                  */
01271                 list_for_each_entry(ns, ldlm_namespace_list(client),
01272                                     ns_list_chain)
01273                 {
01274                         if (!equal && ns->ns_appetite != LDLM_NAMESPACE_GREEDY)
01275                                 continue;
01276 
01277                         if (equal) {
01278                                 /*
01279                                  * In the case 2/3 locks are eaten out by
01280                                  * modest pools, we re-setup equal limit
01281                                  * for _all_ pools.
01282                                  */
01283                                 l = LDLM_POOL_HOST_L /
01284                                         ldlm_namespace_nr_read(client);
01285                         } else {
01286                                 /*
01287                                  * All the rest of greedy pools will have
01288                                  * all locks in equal parts.
01289                                  */
01290                                 l = (LDLM_POOL_HOST_L - nr_l) /
01291                                         (ldlm_namespace_nr_read(client) -
01292                                          nr_p);
01293                         }
01294                         ldlm_pool_setup(&ns->ns_pool, l);
01295                 }
01296                 mutex_unlock(ldlm_namespace_lock(client));
01297         }
01298 
01299         /*
01300          * Recalc at least ldlm_namespace_nr(client) namespaces.
01301          */
01302         for (nr = ldlm_namespace_nr_read(client); nr > 0; nr--) {
01303                 int     skip;
01304                 /*
01305                  * Lock the list, get first @ns in the list, getref, move it
01306                  * to the tail, unlock and call pool recalc. This way we avoid
01307                  * calling recalc under @ns lock what is really good as we get
01308                  * rid of potential deadlock on client nodes when canceling
01309                  * locks synchronously.
01310                  */
01311                 mutex_lock(ldlm_namespace_lock(client));
01312                 if (list_empty(ldlm_namespace_list(client))) {
01313                         mutex_unlock(ldlm_namespace_lock(client));
01314                         break;
01315                 }
01316                 ns = ldlm_namespace_first_locked(client);
01317 
01318                 if (ns_old == ns) { /* Full pass complete */
01319                         mutex_unlock(ldlm_namespace_lock(client));
01320                         break;
01321                 }
01322 
01323                 /* We got an empty namespace, need to move it back to inactive
01324                  * list.
01325                  * The race with parallel resource creation is fine:
01326                  * - If they do namespace_get before our check, we fail the
01327                  *   check and they move this item to the end of the list anyway
01328                  * - If we do the check and then they do namespace_get, then
01329                  *   we move the namespace to inactive and they will move
01330                  *   it back to active (synchronised by the lock, so no clash
01331                  *   there).
01332                  */
01333                 if (ldlm_ns_empty(ns)) {
01334                         ldlm_namespace_move_to_inactive_locked(ns, client);
01335                         mutex_unlock(ldlm_namespace_lock(client));
01336                         continue;
01337                 }
01338 
01339                 if (ns_old == NULL)
01340                         ns_old = ns;
01341 
01342                 spin_lock(&ns->ns_lock);
01343                 /*
01344                  * skip ns which is being freed, and we don't want to increase
01345                  * its refcount again, not even temporarily. bz21519 & LU-499.
01346                  */
01347                 if (ns->ns_stopping) {
01348                         skip = 1;
01349                 } else {
01350                         skip = 0;
01351                         ldlm_namespace_get(ns);
01352                 }
01353                 spin_unlock(&ns->ns_lock);
01354 
01355                 ldlm_namespace_move_to_active_locked(ns, client);
01356                 mutex_unlock(ldlm_namespace_lock(client));
01357 
01358                 /*
01359                  * After setup is done - recalc the pool.
01360                  */
01361                 if (!skip) {
01362                         int ttime = ldlm_pool_recalc(&ns->ns_pool);
01363 
01364                         if (ttime < time)
01365                                 time = ttime;
01366 
01367                         ldlm_namespace_put(ns);
01368                 }
01369         }
01370 
01371         /* Wake up the blocking threads from time to time. */
01372         ldlm_bl_thread_wakeup();
01373 
01374         return time;
01375 }
01376 
01377 static int ldlm_pools_thread_main(void *arg)
01378 {
01379         struct ptlrpc_thread *thread = (struct ptlrpc_thread *)arg;
01380         int s_time, c_time;
01381         ENTRY;
01382 
01383         thread_set_flags(thread, SVC_RUNNING);
01384         wake_up(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
01385 
01386         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "%s: pool thread starting, process %d\n",
01387                "ldlm_poold", current_pid());
01388 
01389         while (1) {
01390                 struct l_wait_info lwi;
01391 
01392                 /*
01393                  * Recal all pools on this tick.
01394                  */
01395                 s_time = ldlm_pools_recalc(LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER);
01396                 c_time = ldlm_pools_recalc(LDLM_NAMESPACE_CLIENT);
01397 
01398                 /*
01399                  * Wait until the next check time, or until we're
01400                  * stopped.
01401                  */
01402                 lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT(cfs_time_seconds(min(s_time, c_time)),
01403                                   NULL, NULL);
01404                 l_wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq,
01405                              thread_is_stopping(thread) ||
01406                              thread_is_event(thread),
01407                              &lwi);
01408 
01409                 if (thread_test_and_clear_flags(thread, SVC_STOPPING))
01410                         break;
01411                 else
01412                         thread_test_and_clear_flags(thread, SVC_EVENT);
01413         }
01414 
01415         thread_set_flags(thread, SVC_STOPPED);
01416         wake_up(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
01417 
01418         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "%s: pool thread exiting, process %d\n",
01419                 "ldlm_poold", current_pid());
01420 
01421         complete_and_exit(&ldlm_pools_comp, 0);
01422 }
01423 
01424 static int ldlm_pools_thread_start(void)
01425 {
01426         struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
01427         struct task_struct *task;
01428         ENTRY;
01429 
01430         if (ldlm_pools_thread != NULL)
01431                 RETURN(-EALREADY);
01432 
01433         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(ldlm_pools_thread);
01434         if (ldlm_pools_thread == NULL)
01435                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01436 
01437         init_completion(&ldlm_pools_comp);
01438         init_waitqueue_head(&ldlm_pools_thread->t_ctl_waitq);
01439 
01440         task = kthread_run(ldlm_pools_thread_main, ldlm_pools_thread,
01441                            "ldlm_poold");
01442         if (IS_ERR(task)) {
01443                 CERROR("Can't start pool thread, error %ld\n", PTR_ERR(task));
01444                 OBD_FREE(ldlm_pools_thread, sizeof(*ldlm_pools_thread));
01445                 ldlm_pools_thread = NULL;
01446                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(task));
01447         }
01448         l_wait_event(ldlm_pools_thread->t_ctl_waitq,
01449                      thread_is_running(ldlm_pools_thread), &lwi);
01450         RETURN(0);
01451 }
01452 
01453 static void ldlm_pools_thread_stop(void)
01454 {
01455         ENTRY;
01456 
01457         if (ldlm_pools_thread == NULL) {
01458                 EXIT;
01459                 return;
01460         }
01461 
01462         thread_set_flags(ldlm_pools_thread, SVC_STOPPING);
01463         wake_up(&ldlm_pools_thread->t_ctl_waitq);
01464 
01465         /*
01466          * Make sure that pools thread is finished before freeing @thread.
01467          * This fixes possible race and oops due to accessing freed memory
01468          * in pools thread.
01469          */
01470         wait_for_completion(&ldlm_pools_comp);
01471         OBD_FREE_PTR(ldlm_pools_thread);
01472         ldlm_pools_thread = NULL;
01473         EXIT;
01474 }
01475 
01476 int ldlm_pools_init(void)
01477 {
01478         int rc;
01479         DEF_SHRINKER_VAR(shsvar, ldlm_pools_srv_shrink,
01480                          ldlm_pools_srv_count, ldlm_pools_srv_scan);
01481         DEF_SHRINKER_VAR(shcvar, ldlm_pools_cli_shrink,
01482                          ldlm_pools_cli_count, ldlm_pools_cli_scan);
01483         ENTRY;
01484 
01485         rc = ldlm_pools_thread_start();
01486         if (rc == 0) {
01487                 ldlm_pools_srv_shrinker =
01488                         set_shrinker(DEFAULT_SEEKS, &shsvar);
01489                 ldlm_pools_cli_shrinker =
01490                         set_shrinker(DEFAULT_SEEKS, &shcvar);
01491         }
01492         RETURN(rc);
01493 }
01494 
01495 void ldlm_pools_fini(void)
01496 {
01497         if (ldlm_pools_srv_shrinker != NULL) {
01498                 remove_shrinker(ldlm_pools_srv_shrinker);
01499                 ldlm_pools_srv_shrinker = NULL;
01500         }
01501         if (ldlm_pools_cli_shrinker != NULL) {
01502                 remove_shrinker(ldlm_pools_cli_shrinker);
01503                 ldlm_pools_cli_shrinker = NULL;
01504         }
01505         ldlm_pools_thread_stop();
01506 }
